content: I cannot solve the issue, but I'll share a possible cause. I presume this is a POP account. If so, there is a file named popstate.dat in the profile folder that keeps track of last downloaded message to prevent what you are describing. Now, if some process is running (antivirus?) that is preventing thunderbird from saving that file, then it never updates and keeps downloading the same messages. If you check in profile folder, in the Mail folder for the account, you will see the file. To get there: - click help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll down to 'profile folder', click 'open folder', exit thunderbird. You are now in the profile. Click the Mail folder and then the account folder to see the popstate.dat file.
creator: davidsk

Prova con queste operazioni di manutenzione:

  5. Riavviare Thunderbird

content:
The same as the difference between version 115 and 128. The ESR tag is a prelude to moving back to a monthly release schedule like Firefox uses. With the Extended Support Release (ESR), which has been the version of Thunderbird released for most of the last 10 years going back to having that designation.

See https://enterprise.thunderbird.net/explore/thunderbird-release-cycle

And https://www.pcworld.com/article/2478480/thunderbird-gets-a-new-release-channel-with-monthly-feature-updates.html

content:
You will have top ask Norton how to enable their self signed encryption certificates in Thunderbird. There used to be instructions on their web site, but that appear to have been removed.

Fundamentally encryption certificates are issues in a chain of trust and that chain of trust does not honor self signed certificates. A manual over ride is required.

My personal choice is to simply stop the product scanning email and everything will just work i.e. the problem is Norton, not Thunderbird.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
I sometimes get burned when attempting to help a Mac user, but I think these steps will work - and since they don't corrupt anything, they should cause no problems:

  1. in thunderbird, click help>troubleshootinginformation
  2. scroll down to 'profile foldler' in left column and click 'open folder'
  3. exit thunderbird, you are now in profile. Notice the folder in which the profile is located.
  4. copy your backup profile into the same folder as the current profile. remember its name
  5. restart thunderbird
  6. click help>troubleshootinginformation
  7. scroll down this time to 'profiles' and click 'about:profiles'
  8. click the 'create profile button
  9. click next
  10. enter a short name for the profile, such as OLDPROFILE
  11. click the choose button to locate and select your profile
  12. click finish and launch
creator: davidsk

content:
This sounds like you are talking about creating a new message in the 'Write' window. This issue seems to have been around for a while. What OS are you using...Windows, MAC, Linux ? If MAC or Linux OS - where did you get the download - eg: snap, flatpack If Windows - did you get Thunderbird from official download website or via Windows app ? What version of Thunderbird are you using ?

The first thing to check is does it work better or the same in Troubleshooting mode. eg: does it stop showing different coloured font.

  • In Thunderbird - Help > Troubleshoot Mode
  • Pop up window - click on 'Continue in Troubleshoot Mode'
  • REport on results.

You mention "the recipient dropdown started showing grey on some listed entries and white for others, " I presume you are not talking about using the Contacts Sidebar. Perhaps you start to type in the 'TO' field and see drop down list.

It would be helpful if you posted an image showing this - even if you partially blank out - providing some part is showing the issue.

Does this go away in TRoubleshoot Mode ?

Test Theme: The colour of the background and the text colour will depends upon what theme you are using. For test purposes you would need to select a theme which is supplied by default: Settings > Add-ons and Themes > select 'Themes' > choose Light or Dark.

Please tell us if you are using any other theme and if you installed a theme then the name of the theme. Do you get issue when using Dark or Light theme ?

Address Books: Do you only use the default address books - Personal Address Book and Collected Addresses ? Do you have other address books which you manually created?

Have you noticed if the greyed text contacts in drop down list are always from a specific address book ?
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Thunderbird is being prevented from saving the prefs.js file when shut down. When you delete the account, it appears deleted because thunderbird is hold the deletion in memory, to be updated at shutdown. But if prevented from updating the prefs.js file, on restart, it reloads the file and the account displays again. The same explanation applies to the message view layout. The challenge is finding the culprit, maybe an antivirus? If you browse profile outside of thunderbird in windows file explorer, you might see multiple copies of prefs.js, such as prefs-1.js, prefs-2.js, etc. If so, I would delete all versions except the one with highest number, and then rename that one to prefs.js and restart thunderbird. My guess is the deleted account will now be gone.
creator: davidsk

content: if you had to enter your email address manually, it usually means cookies aren't accepted in TB Settings/Privacy & Security, and the OAuth authentication doesn't complete and store a token in Saved Passwords (which is read automatically at each connection). Accept cookies, restart TB, and see if the address appears automatically, and enter the password.

content:
The breaches listed by Mozilla Monitor are listed at https://monitor.mozilla.org/breaches

See also https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/what-do-after-data-breach https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/resolve-breaches-firefox-monitor

Btw Thunderbird is a email client and there is no such thing as a Thunderbird Account like there is with Mozilla Accounts https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/access-mozilla-services-firefox-account

Nobody here on the community support forum does direct support by phone, chat or email so posting your email in public is not a good idea.
